Headings.Syntax: # for H1, ## for H2, ### for H3, and so on up to ###### for H6
Headings.Description: Used to create headings of different levels. One '#' represents the largest heading (H1).

Bold.Description: Encloses the text in double asterisks or underscores to make it bold.

Italics.Description: Encloses the text in single asterisks or underscores to italicize it.

Bold and Italics.Description: Combines both bold and italic by using triple asterisks or underscores.

Lists.Description: Creates unordered lists using dashes or asterisks and ordered lists using numbers followed by a period.

Links.Description: Creates a hyperlink with the visible text enclosed in square brackets and the URL in parentheses.

Images.Description: Embeds an image. The alt text is displayed if the image cannot be loaded.

Blockquotes.Description: Creates a blockquote by starting the line with a greater-than sign.

Code.Description: Inline code is enclosed in backticks (`), and code blocks are enclosed in triple backticks.

Horizontal Rule.Description: Creates a horizontal line by using three dashes, asterisks, or underscores.

Tables.Description: Creates a table using pipes and dashes. The first row is the header.

Strikethrough.Description: Encloses the text in double tildes to strike through it.

Inline HTML.Description: Allows embedding raw HTML for styling or content that Markdown does not natively support.

Escaping Special Characters.Description: Adds a backslash before special characters to treat them as literal text rather than Markdown syntax.

Custom IDs for Headings.Description: Assigns a custom HTML ID to a heading, useful for linking directly to a section.

Footnotes.Syntax:
Here is a footnote reference[^1]

[^1]: The footnote text.
Footnotes.Example:
Markdown supports footnotes[^1].

[^1]: This is the footnote.

Admonitions.Example:
!!! note "Take Note"
    This is an important note.
Admonitions.Description: Used to create styled callouts for notes, warnings, tips, etc. (specific to certain Markdown parsers).

Definition Lists.Example:
Markdown
: A lightweight markup language for formatting text.
Definition Lists.Description: Provides an elegant way to define terms and their descriptions.

Emoji Shortcodes.Description: Inserts emojis if supported by the Markdown parser.

TOC (Table of Contents).Description: Automatically generates a table of contents based on headings, depending on the Markdown processor.

Automatic Links.Description: Automatically creates a hyperlink for a valid URL enclosed in angle brackets.

Hard Line Breaks.Syntax: Add two spaces at the end of a line.
Hard Line Breaks.Description: Forces a line break without starting a new paragraph.

Highlighting.Description: Adds a highlight effect to the text (supported by some Markdown processors).

Superscript.Description: Formats text as superscript (commonly used in mathematical or scientific content).

Anchor Links.Description: Creates an internal link to a heading or section within the same document.

HTML Comments.Example: <!-- This won't be visible in the rendered output -->
HTML Comments.Description: Adds comments that wonâ€™t appear in the rendered output but are visible in the source Markdown file.

Math Blocks (LaTeX).Description: Allows rendering mathematical equations using LaTeX syntax.

Task List States.Description: Adds checkbox-style task lists, with `[ ]` for incomplete and `[x]` for completed tasks.

Table Alignment.Syntax:
| Left-aligned | Center-aligned | Right-aligned |
|:-------------|:--------------:|--------------:|
| Value 1      |     Value 2    |         Value 3 |
Table Alignment.Description: Aligns table columns using colons (`:`). `:---` aligns left, `:---:` centers, and `---:` aligns right.

Syntax.Hard: Add two spaces at the end of a line.

Line Breaks (Hard and Soft).Example:
This is a line.  
This is another line.
Line Breaks (Hard and Soft).Description: Differentiates between soft and hard line breaks based on spacing at the end of the line.

Collapsible Sections.Syntax:
<details>
<summary>Click to expand</summary>
Content inside collapsible section.
</details>
Collapsible Sections.Example:
<details>
<summary>More Information</summary>
Here is some additional information.
</details>
